yaml.title: Adilene Garibay
yaml.subtitle: Master of Science in Social Data Analytics and Research

markdown.markdown:
Welcome! This site serves as a digital portfolio for my graduate work product. Here, I document my journey through the Social Data Analytics and Research program, focusing on the intersection of data science, social patterns, and actionable insights. [About Me]{style="font-size: 1.2em;"} I am a graduate student currently exploring the world of **Knowledge Mining**, NLP, and predictive modeling. My goal is to leverage data-driven methodologies to solve complex social problems. [Featured Coursework]{style="font-size: 1.2em;"} Exploring the DIKW hierarchy, neural extraction methods, and the "AI for Science" paradigm to transform raw data into actionable insights. #### Data Collection Methods Focusing on the systematic gathering of social data, survey design, and ensuring data integrity for robust research outcomes. #### Data Visualization Translating complex data sets into intuitive, high-impact visual narratives to aid in decision-making and public communication. [Contact]{style="font-size: 1.2em;"} - **GitHub:** [AdileneGaribay](https://github.com/AdileneGaribay) - **Email:** dal661311\@utdallas.edu

This website was developed as part of my graduate coursework. Technical assistance and structural guidance were provided by Gemini 1.5 Flash (LLM).
